The Sprint dashboard
The Sprint dashboard allows displaying the progress (route) of an object on the process (sprint).
Data acquisition is performed dynamically (in real time). The use of data sources is not provided.
To set up the "Sprint" dashboard, you must first drag the panel to the workspace.
Keep in mind that
data for the dashboard is borrowed from "WorkFlow. Deadline instance"
. Data is acquired dynamically (in real time). ''The use of
data sources
is not provided.
Dashboard settings enable debugging of object filtering. Most often, the object of a business process is an Application for decision-making. To configure the panel, use the following parameters:
Basic settings
Setting
Purpose
Name
Enter the setting name.
BP
Entering/selecting a previously configured business process to display.
Filtering algorithm
Entering/selecting a filtering algorithm for objects to display.
Object type
Entering/selecting a route type of the item to display.
The full list of types in the parameter’s drop-down list becomes available after clicking the "Show all types" button
. This button is displayed if the user has the "Run" permission for
"View system types in the "Object type" registry"
.
Value calculation function
Selecting a function to calculate total values, i.e. the values of all indicators of the deadline: planned period, delay, deviation. Available options:
• Maximum
• Minimum
• Average
• Median
• Amount
Filtering options
Setting
Purpose
Department
Selecting the department of users whose applications (or other objects) will be counted in the dashboard. It is specified after defining the value type used, possible options:
• Constant
• Reference to the parameter
Start date
Selecting the start date to calculate the deadline. It is specified after defining the value type used, possible options:
• Current date
• Constant
• Reference to the parameter
End date
Selecting the end date to calculate the deadline. It is specified after defining the value type used, possible options:
• Current date
• Constant
• Reference to the parameter
If you filter by the start and end dates of the deadline, the dashboard will display information on those objects (applications/requests) that generate deadlines within the period specified.
The number of objects (applications/requests) and their percentage are calculated automatically.
The dashboard view
is configured using the following buttons:
– editing the item name
– setting up the business process block (sprint); parameters are duplicated with the general settings Specified
priority item parameters
. The number of deadlines to choose from is limited by their availability in the previously specified business process.
– adding an item
– delete an item
– delete an item
Entering/changing the item name is done manually, after which you need to
press Enter
on your keyboard. Double-click to enter/change the name of a stage or a sub-stage.
The configured
Sprint
panel is displayed in the dashboard according to the settings made.
